snippet: The recent number of mistakes documented at federal laboratories involving anthrax, flu and smallpox viruses have contributed to a debate over lax government oversight at high-level containment labs.
abstract: Federal reports show that hundreds of mistakes occurred in recent years across sprawling web of academic, commercial and government laboratories that operate without clear national standards or oversight; latest mistakes documented at federal labs involving anthrax, flu and smallpox have incited outrage, but they account for tiny fraction of mistakes at so-called 'high-level containment' labs set up to work with risky microbes.

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting.
